page.title: 14THE OLD GRANGE
page.content: THE OLD GRANGE DATES BACK TO THE 12TH CENTURY & NOW BELONGS TO MR A.SALTER. A CISTERCIAN MONASTERY AT BRUERN ABBEY BOUGHT 6 FARMS WITHIN A 10 MILE RADIUS. EACH WAS A GRANGE BUILT OF TIMBER THEN STONE.THEY BUILT FISH POND USING WATER FROM A SPRING. THEY DUG OUT A RECTANGLE 10x40 YARDS, PUT IN A SLUICE AND LET THE WATER IN.THE BASE OF THE POND IS MADE OF IMPERVIOUS BLUE CLAY.TO THIS DAY WATER LEAVES THE POND TO JOIN THE RIVER SEVERN EVENTUALLY. THERE IS ALSO A 13TH CENTURY DOVECOTE IN THE GARDEN. A FAMOUS STORY IS THAT DICK TURPIN STOPPED AT THE OLD GRANGE TO REST BLACK BESS IN THE STABLE.THERE IS SUPPOSED TO BE THE GHOST OF A PAST OWNER WHO WAS BURNT TO DEATH IN A FIRE BUT NOW 'WALKS' TO THE STAG'S HEAD AT SWALCLIFFE EACH NIGHT FOR A DRINK.IN 1953 MR SALTER MOVED IN & HAVE PUT IN ELECTRICITY, RUNNING WATER & TELEPHONE
